page.title: 05Dairy Herd, N. Lopham
page.content:
On the Alstons' farm (see page 4) the cows are taken into the cow sheds for winter during November. They are put out to grass again about the second week of April. Apart from Summer feed of grass, they are fed in Winter on hay, maize, beet tops and silage. The value of one cow is about Â£500. Two people work full time with the cows. The cows have already won over 40 prizes at agricultural shows.
The milking parlour is about to have new equipment, but at the moment 10 cows can be milked on one side, while a second 10 are lined up on the other side. The udders are cleaned, clusters are attached and the milk is piped first to individual jars and then into two huge cooling tanks. Milking times are 4.30 a.m., 2.30 p.m.
